Format.ReportDescription:
This report shows how average lateness varies along a route.

The report is best run for a single route. You may narrow down the selection by specifying particular services and directions of operation.Output may be grouped by direction and by service code.

Operator
Only trips operated by the selected operators will be reported.

Route
Only trips for selected routes will be reported.

Service
Only trips for the selected services will be reported

Split By Service?
Check the box to display lateness progress for each service pattern

Direction
Only trips for the selected direction will be reported

Split By Direction?
Check the box to display lateness progress for each direction

Location
Only lateness values recorded at the specified locations will be reported

Running Board
Only trips for the selected direction will be reported

Trip
Only the specified trips will be reported

Vehicle
Only trips operated by the selected vehicle will be reported

Date, Time, Day Of Week
Only data for trips for the selected dates, time and days of week will be reported.

Grouping
Select Daily to show average lateness change over each day, Hourly to show average lateness change for each hour of the day or None to produce average lateness for the reporting period as a whole.

Show Min/Max
Check this box to present the maximum lateness value and the minimum lateness value at each location.

Lateness Tolerance
Arrivals that are late by more than this value will be excluded from the report as they are considered erroneous

Select the type of Output and Level of Detail required and pressExecute

Query.WhereSql: AND t_summary.route_id = route.route_id AND t_summary.location_id = location.location_id

QueryColumn.Name: grouper
QueryColumn.ColumnName: route.route_code || "-" || t_summary.service_code || "-" || pubdate || "-" || pubhour || "-" || dirgroup || "_" || tripgroup

PreSQL.SQLText: CREATE TEMP TABLE t_times ( from_time DATETIME HOUR TO SECOND, to_time DATETIME HOUR TO SECOND )

Query.WhereSql: AND operator.operator_id IN ( SELECT route_for_user.operator_id FROM route_for_user )
AND route.route_id = service.route_id AND TODAY between wef_date AND wet_date AND route.route_id IN ( SELECT route_for_user.route_id FROM route_for_user )
